description: From Spanish resaca, probably from resacar (“retake”), though possibly from rio seco (“dry river”) instead.

entries.meaning: A dry river bed, a former channel of the Rio Grande, found in the southern half of Cameron County, Texas and deep into northeastern portions of the State of Tamaulipas, Mexico.
examples: Even the springs at Carrizo are barely flowing; it is said this is a result of the irrigation. The resacas have all gone dry.
